oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Oklahoma Roundup Aired Performance - 1946-10-07 - KOMA - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part one of an aired performance from the Oklahoma Roundup radio program on October 7, 1946 on radio station KOMA (Oklahoma City, Okla). Staff includes Hiram Higsby (master of ceremonies, writer), Allan Page (announcer, director), and Kenyon Brown (producer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Little Willie; Chuck Davis; Roundup Boys; Homegrown Trio; Hiram Higsby; Ann Bond; Oklahoma Songbirds
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Opening theme and statements / (1:40) Hiram Higsby tells a joke / (1:53) Little Willie [phonetic], Chuck Davis, and the Roundup Boys perform "Steel Guitar Rag" / (3:45) Hiram Higsby and Allan Page tell a joke / (4:25) The Homegrown Trio performs "Hold That Critter Down" / (6:06) Hiram Higsby and Allan Page tell a joke / (6:30) Hiram Higsby performs "Father Put The Cow Away" / (8:50) Hiram Higsby and Ann Bond tell a joke / (9:40) Ann Bond performs "Back Home In Indiana" / (11:46) Hiram Higsby and Allan Page tell a joke / (12:20) The Oklahoma Songbirds perform "Though I Tried" [unconfirmed] / (14:24) Hiram Higsby and Lem Hawkins tells a joke [incomplete]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Oklahoma Roundup; KOMA (Radio station : Oklahoma City, Okla.); CBS Inc.; Davis, Chuck; Higsby, Hiram, 1909-1975; Bond, Ann;
